annotation.TEXT: Diamond Blizzard (Hard)
Found it! (Of course, it was in the last place I looked... mainly because I stop looking after I find it.)
Yeah, I figured 3 hits wouldn't be enough. She's probably got 7 HP in total, just like the previous Koopalings I've fought in this hack that normally take 3 stomps.
To be continued... Ze!
Umm... Why were my power ups filtered out here?
So, yeah, knock me off Yoshi all you want, Chucks! Of course, I still want to be sure I can retrieve Yoshi each time, and I still have to watch out for the muncher ceiling.
A mushroom? ...Wait... Can I...?
And, these houses' chimneys do act like pipes...
Alright, I guess I have to make my Yoshi grow up before I reach the first ON/OFF switch.
Okay, screw it. That Ptooie's continuing to be obstructive, and I just took a dumb hit checking something that I knew wouldn't work.
D'oh, I should've been able to finish her there (assuming 7 total HP).
Well, that was weird, how most of my dead body ended up behind layer 1 there. But, I'm still just as dead.

1. When the switches are Off, you have to be on Yoshi or you die. 2. Taking a cape will turn you into Fire Mario. 3. There are blocks only breakable with fire. 4. Limitations 1 and 2 won't take effect in the next room.
Whoa, that was a close call, and I ended up leaving Yoshi behind. I hope I didn't need him anymore. Well, there's midpoint, so I should be okay.
Hello, and welcome back to Scarlet Devil Mario! Last time, I played the Green Switch Palace and got walled by a turn block wall several times.
Oh, wait... Weren't there munchers on top of the chimney outside?
Another ON/OFF switch. Oh, wait... It was already ON... So, I guess it switched back to ON when I "died" earlier, and that's why I could leave Yoshi freely afterwards.
So, yeah. I can now leave Yoshi as much as I want without dying! Also, the in-game music stopped with the death jingle, but I decided to bring back the White Ice music.
That Pokey is a major obstacle. If Wendy appears on the opposite side of it from me, then I probably can't hit her.
Now, I don't see any other way out besides the chimney. Maybe I could try holding down as I leave the chimney to reenter it?
Demo count: 32
Well, there was a power up, but that's pointless, since this house has a power up filter in it for whatever dumb reason.
Whoa. That P-switch gave me quite a bit of help with those parts!
Yes.
Ah, some actual in-game custom music. Don't need White Ice anymore.
...Well, it can't be a door, since I'm supposed to carry the P-switch outside, so it's gotta be a pipe.
Man, this would be pretty tricky if I hadn't just broken the gimmick like that.
Now, the vanilla boss music played here, but since this is a more interesting fight than Hard Rumia, I muted the game audio and put in this Super Bomberman theme.
No need to cut out the vanilla music this time, since it won't last nearly long enough to be an issue.
Okay, what am I missing here? (*Pauses to look at that message box's translation again*) ..."And there's a secret passage in this house."... Ah, I overlooked that.
Of course, I must never press the A button while the switch is OFF, and I must also never get knocked off of Yoshi by any enemies.
So, maybe there's a hidden pipe or door leading out of that house.
Alright, now that I have my trusty steed with me this time, I can hit this ON/OFF switch without dying.
Wow, that Koopa pulled off 4 successful jumps in a row, and I was wondering if he'd ever get hit by the shell.
I believe that's 5 hits so far.
And there it is.
BGM: Bomberman 64 - White Ice
I guess I'll keep going until I reach the first ON/OFF switch.
Got lucky there. Okay, now I know that message said that the second house's door is locked, but I gotta confirm this anyway... if Ptooie would just get out of my way...
If this works, I hope I don't end up in a TEST level...
Okay, let's try not to place Yoshi near the left edge of the screen this time...
Ooh, feather. Of course, as the message at the start said, grabbing a feather here makes me fiery.
Demo count: πr²
So, let's begin Icicle Fall (Hard) here! No Yoshis because they heard Link play Epona's Song and all went running to him.
Oh, my god... Did that actually work? Did I actually just totally break the level gimmick? ...Hahaha!!!
Demo count: 33
There must've been solid-only-for-enemy blocks keeping that Paragoomba in place there.
Somehow, I wasn't hit there.
No music on the overworld following that boss fight. Anyway, next time, I'll be taking on a 2-exit level that has the correct name for Icicle Fall's harder counterparts!
Oh, man. Optical illusion ropes, which can make your eyes think they're slanted even though they're actually still perfectly horizontal.
Is that Chuck kicking volleyballs at me? Are you trying to be like Asuka from Tobari? ...Oh! I never did try whacking Asuka with my staff! I'll try to remember to next time.
Now, as you probably noticed on my first attempt, these wood blocks bounce you away if you bump into them from the side, so be careful.
Ah, the silver-P bug, where it acts blue after being taken through a pipe, right?
...Well! I'm totally a goner now!
If I hadn't taken that dumb hit in front of the locked door, I could've entered this fight big (unless there was yet another filter). But, this doesn't seem too terribly hard.
Anyway, let's search every nook and cranny for it... after I get rid of the Chucks.
BGM: Super Bomberman - Boss Battle
Definitely way more interesting than Rumia. (Also, yeah, I think I was slightly off with cutting back to the game audio there. Whatever.)
That's interesting how that midpoint entrance works.
At least Disco Dan worked correctly that time.
OMNOMNOM! I'd've been able to eat that Lava Lotus even without breaking the level gimmick.
Okay, so I can't go out the chimney... Did I miss anything that I could've done outside?

There are only two houses here. The second one's door is locked, so you can't get in that way. You'll probably have to use the silver-P bug. And there's a secret passage in this house. (9): "Sorry. Once more, from the beginning!"
And yep, the P-switch acts blue here, unlike in the VLDC9 Base ROM, where that glitch was fixed.
That should be hit #6.
I think that yellow Koopa was supposed to hop in that shell and disco dance towards me, but he went the wrong way. Whoops.
So, I did the sound channel disabling thing again to deal with that.
Cool, I got him to grow more quickly with the multi-gulp glitch.
Aw, nuts. My hex edits removed the music from the "No Yoshi" screen, but the level itself played the vanilla SMW Athletic theme anyway.
Bingo! Yep, 7 hits is what it took to defeat her!
So, here we have boss time, against Wendy!
This is almost dangerous.
Demo count: 31
